Name:
Mandrake
Haste
Builder: Morton Engineering and Dry Dock Co., Quebec, Canada
Laid down: 11 December 1941 as Canadian corvette hull CN-310
Fate:
Transferred to the US Navy, 6 April 1943
Sold in 1949 to Carlo Cameli of Genoa, Italy as a ferry/transport and renamed Porto Azzuro; Sold in 1950 to S. A. Nav. Toscana of Leghorn, Italy; Scrapped in 1971.
Propulsion: two 3-drum express boilers, one 2,750iph Canadian Vickers vertical triple expansion engine, one shaft.
Armament:
2 × 3"/50 dual purpose gun mounts
2 × 20 mm gun mounts
1 × Hedgehog
4 × depth charge guns
2 × depth charge chutes
